I initially bought this game on release, given my excitement for a new horror game with friends, it was a no brainer. I hit the survivor rank 1 within a month and I can completely agree, survivors were incredibly broken for awhile after release. However after having just come back to the game, I am incredibly disappointed at just how much the survivors have been nerfed. I've played approx. 15 games with a friend since coming back and in only 1 of those games did I escape. That's not balance. On top of most actions granting less points, I noticed that objective speeds have been greatly reduced. This makes a high risk low reward for just about every action you take, as it really seems like the killers haven't been nerfed in the slightest. The biggest problem with this game is that the top percentile can easily abuse it and the people who are here for a casual experience are being turned away.

Dead by Daylight is a great game in my opinion. The developers bring new content at a consistant rate and are in touch with the community. The community isn't as "toxic" as some people think; when i was starting I was often asking for help and more advanced players always gave me advise (however, as in most multiplayer games, there is a small ammount of players, who dedicate themselfs to making you quit - don't let them get to you: there's nothing more satisfying than watching them fail :D ). The game can seem difficult when you start, but it becomes easier as you get to know the mechanics and maps (doesn't mean that it can't be challenging at times, especially at higher ranks) - i reccoment going threw the in-game tutorial to get to know the basics. The game as a large set of playable characters. All the diferent killers have their unique playstyle. Unfortunatly, I can't say the same for survivors. There are many DLC's but to enjoy the game you don't need to buy any; the developers made sure, that they don't split the community by adding pay walls in the form of DLC, and with the recent update players can buy most DLC characters with in-game currency along with cosmetics for characters, that you already own (licensed characters are an exception). Currently the game has balance issues but with the recent updates the developers are at a right path to changing that. I reccoment this game to everyone, who likes multiplayer games about teamwork and outsmarting the other player.

In conclusion, before buying this game test it a few games on a friend account because it can be a very easy waste of money.

Overall it is really a great game and well thought. BUT, it really needs refinement. I cannot tell you how many times the bugs in the game made me forfgeit a match beacuse I could not move after the game starts. And then we get into the bugs that go on during the game. Falling though the map, being  laaunched by unknown forces, displpacement and many more. The community itlself its another problem too. And the releationship between developers and community seems all but cooperative and on good terms. I would bet anything, that if they took the hours they do their weekely streams to brag about a "good job" and acutally get in, hunt the bugs and test the game in multiple runs, this game would be regarded much, MUCH better. I would recommend it as it is, but it still feels like an unrefined game.

A decently fun party game, definitely would recommend if you have a group of friends to play with from time to time, otherwise it loses it's novelty fairly quickly after encountering every killer a couple times. 

It's a casual game at heart so don't be deceived by all the people trashtalking each other, competing in this game is the equivalent of seeing who has more gold stickers in elementary school, the only real thing that you should aim for is getting bloodpoints so you can try out some different characters/builds.

Definitely a fun side game to have though if you got nothing else to do for a hour or two on slow days, I'd recommend to buy it on sale if you and a group of friends are looking towards getting it though.

Yes, You! [/i]

Do [b] YOU [/b] like asymmetrical games where the half the community doesn't realise that the killer is supposed to be the power role?

Do [b] YOU [/b] like games where even though the rules don't state it, its YOUR job to make sure your opponents win?!

Or maybe, you like a game where you can't play with the perks you want because it's up to your opponent(s) to decide what you can and can't use to give yourself an advantage?

If you answered "no" to any of these questions, then you're in luck! because dead by daylight offers all of those! [i][b] And more...![/b][/i]

TL;DR: Community bad, game itself above average.
